triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the core physical platform that UAV swarms are built upon.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics principles are fundamental to the collaborative behavior and coordination of UAV swarms.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: Robotics is the foundational field that encompasses the design and control of autonomous systems including UAV swarms.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Motion planning (path planning) algorithms are essential for coordinating trajectories of multiple UAVs in swarms.

triples.name: Assignment problem
triples.relevance: Task assignment uses assignment problem methods to optimally allocate tasks to individual UAVs in the swarm.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Formation control and coordinated autonomy of UAV swarms are grounded in control theory principles.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is integrated into UAV swarms to improve decision-making, adaptability, and autonomous behavior.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: Artificial intelligence enables autonomous decision-making and intelligent coordination in UAV swarms.

triples.name: Surveillance
triples.relevance: Surveillance is a primary military and civilian application mentioned for UAV swarms.
